comments.text:
We got fooled for the kiss fucking twice. Fool me once, its on you, Fool me twice, and its on me.

Also they should hire Marie at an hospital to investigate those defribilating slaps...   

PD: not gonna bother anymore discussing if its bad or good, its enjoyable and im gonna watch it.

> We got fooled for the kiss fucking twice. Fool me once, its on you, Fool me twice, 

...fool me once I can't get fooled again!
Eh, he already proposed. Kisses are just icing at this point.

She said no though

Show has had more progression in five episode than most romances can with 24
He saw her naked in the first episode and she didn't freak out, which is already more than most romances.
Even better, She was into it

I didn't get fooled. After Chuu2koi S2, I simply refuse to believe any kissing is going to happen until the lips meet.
Instead, I'm looking forward to more creative ways of HOW it's interrupted.

Like here, the first was the normal "male MC chickens out" shtick, but the interrupted kiss of life was golden, if only for RyuZU's confused face XD

Oh, and anyone who still watches this show AND bashes it for being bad this far into the series, I will simply assume they have a... thing for pain and suffering.

Dammit Naoto! As shameless as you are I'm really disappointed you didn't go for the kiss! 

>Hey Bitch. The lil girl ghost seems to be rather full of herself. Is your hole sad because you aren't getting any? Try begging for it. There's a bunch of guys with big cocks just waiting to knock down your door for cheap.

That was some message just to get Marie's attention. I'm impressed that automaton dude was able to send all of that seconds before he was vaporized. XD

I love the recycled [Keijo op](http://i.imgur.com/5U2wkcL.jpg)

rip keijo
[anime_irl](https://i.imgur.com/k95gxcC.png)
Why was this surprising enough to deserve exclamation? She's like 11. Her being a virgin should have been the assumption.
I think she's actually older, she just looks like she's 10
so, what is her actual age?
LEGAL LOLI FTW

The series is getting interesting and I like where this is going. I really like the world building and how there are different opinions on resource usage.  
  
My reaction to the [message](http://i.imgur.com/MtakuMy.jpg) [sent](http://i.imgur.com/v8Amhwd.jpg) to Marie:  
[](#cokemasterrace)  
It made me chuckle and laugh at its hilarity. RyuZU adding [salt](http://i.imgur.com/UMH7atS.jpg) to the wound was savage from her as always.  
  
The beach scene was [fanservicy](http://i.imgur.com/TY9V3xl.jpg), but it was a nice short moment. I liked that they didn't go too long with that. But that kiss interruption:  
[](#moeshitarcher)  
  
The dead city felt really creepy and I like it a lot. I liked the environmental visuals and the mystery and scary feeling of the place - no people, no mechanisms working, strange underground complex with a weapon of mass destruction and that little "killer" loli.  
  
I still don't get why people reacted so harsh on this series. Actually, this is one of the most interesting series this season plot-wise and has one of the best waifus (RyuZU) I have seen in anime. (though I won't lie, that I have a fetish on savage, good-looking and a bit yandere-type girls). The world building is pretty interesting and while I can agree that the 1st episode wasn't great, the series as whole is going pretty well and I would definetely recommend to give it another try to any person who dropped it at the 1st episode.

RyuZU can instantly point the direction to the nearest brothel... I guess she wants to be ready to serve Naoto if he has such a query.

Actually beach scene surprised me by avoiding the boob grab. And RyuZU taking the opportunity to go for the kiss...

> I still don't get why people reacted so harsh on this series

I'd say expectations, visuals and slow building are major factors in this. The visuals, in particular, were a big expectation from the LN style (though the PVs were giving a better idea of the show's style). And the show is still getting better each episode by adding more world building, ironing out but also evolving the characters - which means that those things weren't all thrown at our faces in the first minutes.

This episode was all over the place! [Not sure if spoilers](/s "Having read the manga because I felt there was something wrong with the direction/pacing of the anime, this episode shows whoever is directing the anime is doing a really bad job, so far there's only 27 chapters in the manga and this anime is supposed to have 12 episodes but in just 5 they've covered 15 chapters, this episode covered from chapter 11 to chapter 15 and it cut a lot of information, like, who the half robot guy was, what was his purpose, who were his allies and what they were doing, as well as why Naoto is studying and other stuff, instead we got fanservice, the anime is making Naoto heavily generic and annoying.")

The original source is the LN and not the manga, so they have enough material to cover. They are in the second LN at the beginning, so they will cover the first three. 

Also the manga is rushed compared to the LN and isn't good either, only a better adaptation of the LN

> I still don't get why people reacted so harsh on this series.

Probably a case of expectations vs reality.  I'm enjoying it well enough and plan to keep watching, but it isn't at all what I expected, which put me off a bit at first.

Well I read the first few chapters of the manga, then watched the first episode

The first episode just set a completely... different tone, and it didnt feel right. Like I didn't know the story as a whole, but the manga started off pretty seriously, while the anime really highlighted all the weirder moments of it (And the main character was only maybe 70% the dork he was in that episode)

Seeing the comments here I might go back and give the show another chance though. The manga I read was good but the show just steered me away from it.
For me it was the jarring jumping from serious thriller plot to random sexual undertones or lap pillows
Strange I'm watching it because it has both :))))
Yeah for me I prefer it to be one or the other. Both keijo and paranoia agent are great to me, but in entirely incomparable ways.
I still like this show, fite me.
This entire show is absolutely terrible and I love it.

How'd that dude lose an opposite arm and leg in one motion?

https://i.imgur.com/KVQIVnP.jpg
I don't know but lighting his cigarette with his burning stump was pretty cool.

Somehow the series keeps trucking on just on the right side of being dropped.

I really enjoy the interactions between the main 4 still, I think those moments are the biggest draw (I was not expecting that message to Marie, nor RyuuZus savage response). Some of the depictions of the world are the other thing, the author sometimes does a great job at hinting at more going on without bludgeoning you with infodumps. The scene with Marie getting pissed off at the mecha was a big one of these; you can start to understand how much the cities and their clocktowers mean to her, and that using it to make that feels against everything she's stood for.

I just wish the actual plot felt more inspired. As it is the main 4 seem to have decided to wander the world looking for problems to fix without much by way of explanation.

Lets see where it all goes, I think by now I'm in for the long haul.
I kind of get the purpose though. Naoto just wants to find beautiful machines and Marie wants to just work, though I can't wait to see more of her backstory.

I am enjoying this very much. It's definitely not as bad as others claim it to be. A lot seems to complain about the fanservice, but we need to know that this is still a light novel adaptation, and that it is written by the same guy behind NGNL, which is filled with fanservice. The beach episode this week didn't bother me that much, had a feeling it will come sooner or later, at least they did progress the story. The art and animation didn't improve that much either, if you aren't a fan of this kind of art style, well I'll suggest you the LN or the manga, it's a whole lot better. Anyway, waiting patiently for the next episode.
Can't wait for RyuZU figure swimsuit ver. ;D

This show isn't really what I was expecting before the season started but I somehow always want to see the next episode, it's a bit magical. The only thing that really annoys me is the art of the main girl and boy are so different to the rest of the characters, kinda feels out of place.

The series is really starting to pick up! I'm so happy that we had the main antagonist (I think) and the main protags meet up. I also have to say that Halter is one of my favorite characters this season, he is super chill, but he's also really funny. Excited for next week.

The main and only thing I really dislike about this show is the main mc. Why does he have to tell every other line. I understand he's a kid but damn shut the hell up the person your talking to is right next to you. 

I think the reason I love the manga over the anime is cause I can't hear his yelling all the time. 

Good world building, plot, character design though.

Loving Marie's character. It looks like after she got her introduction, she went for the adventurers life. "I'm gonna save the world, but let's stop at the beach first."

She's also surprisingly honest and straightforward when she talks with the others - especially RyuZU and Naoto, which she clearly trusts a lot.
Naoto being such a pervert while RyuZU is just like, willing to be his slave, really just weirds me out. I'll probably see this show through to the end, but my opinion of it continues to fall.

I'm liking the physics implications of the various special gears. If you could switch your clock to tick forward in imaginary time instead of regular time, a lot of weird stuff would happen. Gravity would work quite differently, for one example, which the show did a great job mentioning without overwhelming. And the new girl at the end seems to have a Perpetual Gear. If you had a gear that simply spun regardless of what you hooked to it, you could in a sense generate as much force as you like given enough transmission gears. She could power the planet, or destroy it.
Annnnnd there's the beach episode. Check that one off the list.
Does this mean hotsprings next? Please let this mean hotsprings next.

Seems obvious the mask is controlling her. Wonder why they even need a km large gearbot of mass destruction.

So did they just kill [this dude](http://i.imgur.com/C5p8l9f.png) along with the robot, or was he already dead?

I was actually kinda excited about this before the season started, but because of various reasons I couldn't watch seasonal anime for the first three weeks and then I saw the score on this when I had the opportunity to watch stuff again and my excitement kinda ~~fell off a cliff~~ went away. What happened?

> What happened?

It's a bad adaptation.  
It's still enjoyable, but if you need something to be good or great and not just enjoyable, you should read the LN or manga instead.

Art style and animation disappointed people, MC disappointed people (shocker), general pacing disappointed people, plot disappointed people. It's what, a 6ish on Mal? Meh, it started out fairly high for me personally but has been gradually dropping, mostly because I'm finding a lot of other shows more enjoyable. It's not bad enough for me to drop, but I probably won't watch it again when I'm done with it.

What happened was that you checked the score in the first place. MAL is cancer. Scores on MAL are cancer².

As for me, I'm loving this anime, and this episode was great as well, even with the cliffhanger.
Also, the plot thickens.
MAL scores on airing shows aren't really to be trusted because many people vote on their first impression and then leave. Just have to try the first three episodes for yourself.
I hate people who rate a show before they've finished it. That shouldn't be allowed.
Maybe they should wait until five episodes or something.

Or, you know, watch the thing you are judging.  
Five episodes isn't even a simple majority of a single cour show.
yeah true should probably only allow voting after it's over

We finally see AnchoR, aww yeah!  

This was a nice little ep, cant wait for next week.  

I like seeing more of the world too.   The dead city was really neat and well done.
does halter have a daughter fetish?

Yeah, the mask has the same pallette as the 1km robot, that was quite obvious... I didn't really like the pacing this episode, somehow felt weird the city was abandoned and nobody realized, probably it's me missing something important. Also I'd appreciate they used a version of the OP without AnchoR until they got her in the crew, but still okay.

The Perpetual Gear thing sounds interesting, let's see what the have for next week.
